results.title: Effect of simvastatin on ischemic signs and symptoms in the Scandinavian simvastatin survival study (4S).
results.text_hl: In @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ participating in the Scandinavian @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ Survival Study, @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ lowering with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ reduced the incidence of @<m>DISEASE_Carotid_Stenosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016893 @@@carotid bruits@@@ and cerebrovascular events as well as new-onset or worsening of @DISEASE_Angina_Pectoris @DISEASE_MESH:D000787 @@@angina pectoris@@@ and @DISEASE_Intermittent_Claudication @DISEASE_MESH:D007383 @@@intermittent claudication@@@.

results.title: [Simvastatin influence on carotid atherosclerotic disease regression].
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: Long-term @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment results in the regression or slowing down @DISEASE_Atherosclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@atherosclerosis@@@ in symptomatic, as well as in asymptomatic @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with a lower grade of @<m>DISEASE_Carotid_Stenosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016893 @@@carotid stenosis@@@ (IMT below 2.5 mm).

results.title: Liposomal simvastatin attenuates neointimal hyperplasia in rats.
results.text_hl: IV injection of liposomal @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ to @<m>DISEASE_Carotid_Stenosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016893 @@@carotid-injured@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ (3 mg/kg, n = 4) resulted in a transient depletion of circulating monocytes, significantly more prolonged than that observed following treatment with free @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

citations.NLM: Afergan E, Ben David M, Epstein H, Koroukhov N, Gilhar D, Rohekar K, Danenberg HD, Golomb G. Liposomal simvastatin attenuates neointimal hyperplasia in rats. AAPS J. 2010 Jun;12(2):181-7. PMID: 20143196

results.title: Suppression of RAGE as a basis of simvastatin-dependent plaque stabilization in type 2 diabetes.
results.text_hl: METHODS AND RESULTS: Seventy @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with asymptomatic @<m>DISEASE_Carotid_Stenosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016893 @@@carotid artery stenosis@@@ (>70%) were randomized to American Heart Association (AHA) step 1 diet plus @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (40 mg/d) or AHA step 1 diet alone for 4 months before endarterectomy.

citations.NLM: Cuccurullo C, Iezzi A, Fazia ML, De Cesare D, Di Francesco A, Muraro R, Bei R, Ucchino S, Spigonardo F, Chiarelli F, Schmidt AM, Cuccurullo F, Mezzetti A, Cipollone F. Suppression of RAGE as a basis of simvastatin-dependent plaque stabilization in type 2 diabetes. Arterioscler Thromb Vasc Biol. 2006 Dec;26(12):2716-23. PMID: 17038636

results.title: Suppression of the functionally coupled cyclooxygenase-2/prostaglandin E synthase as a basis of simvastatin-dependent plaque stabilization in humans.
results.text_hl: METHODS AND RESULTS: Seventy @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with symptomatic @<m>DISEASE_Carotid_Stenosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016893 @@@carotid artery stenosis@@@ were randomized to the American Heart Association Step 1 diet plus @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (40 mg/d) or the American Heart Association Step 1 diet alone for 4 months before endarterectomy.
